place.name: CUXTON
place.gazetteerText: CUXTON, a parish in North Aylesford district, Kent; on the river Medway, and the Strood and Maidstone railway, 2¾ miles SW by S of Strood. It has a station on the railway, and a post office under Rochester. Acres, 1, 756; of which 70 are water. Real property, £2, 189. Pop., 441. Houses, 81. The property is divided among a few. The surface is hilly. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Rochester. Value, £346.* Patron, the Bishop of Rochester. The church is ancient. There is a national school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
